website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, tabletop steam press that is fast, efficient, and easy to use. The best on the market.
pros: Incredibly simple operation and speedy results
cons: Settings panel is digital but not LED

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fusible batting!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this steam press. It's the first I've ever used and I bought it as I make pet products and needed it for pressing fusible batting to fabric and wanted the larger size so I could do bigger areas. So happy with my purchase and it's saving a tremendous amount of time!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie051201

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT REMOVE WRINKLES IN DRESS SHIRTS
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my dress shirts and COULD NOT get the wrinkles out... Watched every video on how to use the machine and followed every tip but the wrinkles remain... Also, spray bottle came with a leak in the bottom so I couldn't use it... Will give it one more shot but not impressed so far...
customer_reviews.author: John Sanderbeck

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve, but I really like using this in conjunction with an iron
customer_reviews.text: There is definitely a learning curve to using this, but I suppose you could say that about general ironing/laundry as well. I was hoping to not have to use an iron anymore, but now I’m figuring out when to use the press and when to use the basic iron. I am hoping with practice I become more proficient because right now I’m not saving any time or energy by using this instead of an iron. I will say, for items that were left in the bottom of a basket or for pressing cargo pants/uniform shirts, this has been great for getting the pocket flaps flattened.
customer_reviews.author: ThinBlueLine

customer_reviews.title: Beats Hand Ironing!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize stainless steel and grasshopper green could make such strikingly attractive combination in looks! Chest and shoulder areas retain visible wrinkles when ironed in cotton setting. The crease on sleeves don't last either. Item was purchased from Amazon Warehouse at a reduced price but a 2x1.25 in chunk was broken off the handle. Would say it was more than a cosmetic defect.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Find videos on YouTube on how to use a garment press.  Very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. I have not had it long so I cannot speak to longevity; however, it does exactly what I was hoping to would do. I watched a couple of videos on how to use a steam press and they taught me how to better maneuver the garment on the press. It is a learning process but I can now do a button down shirt in just a few minutes and they look like I sent them to the cleaners. As a bonus, I now press my cloth napkins, table and handkerchiefs. It is so easy and why not. Amazing difference. I now press my work shirts. Like me, you will probably find many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Searls

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve
customer_reviews.text: This steam/iron is a time saver. I can get through with my ironing in probably half the time. But there is a learning curve. Trying to iron a dress shirt isn't as easy as a t-shirt. Also you really have to watch where you put your hands. If you lift too high you will burn yourself. I am still working on getting the button down shirts ironed like when I do it on an ironing board with a regular iron. But the time I am saving more than makes up for a shirt that has an unwanted crease.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: I tried to Love you, but...
customer_reviews.text: You leaked. You left small pock marks even with a fabric guard. I bought you again... you had moisture in your water cup. You must have been with another woman before me!!! I have an old Conair that still works super...just wicked small for what I need. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: Ron A.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing lasts forever, good unit, good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Gave up the ghost five (5) years after original purchase. Otherwise great product. It cost me $189.99 total to fix the problem (a new unit shipped to me). There's no parts available, and it's too expensive to repair. The cheapest way out is a 30% discount on a new unit through their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality press at all.
customer_reviews.text: This product was so cheap it did not even arrive working . I plugged it in and it was in a red lite beeping mode. I called the company to see if it had a switch that needed to be flipped or something . The representative told me I could return to amazon for money back . The other alternative was to cut the cord and then throw away and they would send another. Not impressed at the lack of quality. They did not even want it back.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Nice ironing
customer_reviews.text: Good product; husband is ironing his shirts it takes about 4 min per shirt; works perfectly. There are some tips on the manual document.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Working good
customer_reviews.text: Brand new now works good- well packed- there's definitely a learning curve if you've only used traditional iron before to get collars and shirt yokes manipulated right- but works good and at my advancing age safer than a loose hot iron I think- bummer when iron falls off ironing board- btw bought the stand too think it's worth it
customer_reviews.author: Ed camp

customer_reviews.title: If you have room in your laundry, this is the ticket for folks with ironing fetishes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Steampress. I love them. When I'm on a roll, I'll even iron my pillow cases like when I was a child- such a good feeling. And ironing tees make them look new. Nothing else will work for those dining rm linens. The one that just died lasted me 20 years. So much better than an iron. Just takes some practice for a novice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Poll

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pressure - I wore the previous 2 out. the pressure looks nice, but My pet peeve is that it doesn't have enough space at the back for excess fabric when pressing shirts, pillowcases or tablecloths. The fabric gets bunched at the back and defeats the purpose of pressing. However, for pants, napkins and small items, it does a perfect job.
customer_reviews.author: GramFall4

customer_reviews.title: Great for pressing fabric for quilting!
customer_reviews.text: The Steam Fast SF-680 is great for quilting!! I purchased this only to press fabric for quilting and sewing. It works great for this!! It heats relatively quickly considering the heat plate is much larger than an iron. I've been able to press strips of fabric for sashing without using a ton of starch because the steam press produced a nice crisp strip of fabric. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the box there was a problem didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box there was a problem didn't even plug it in just added water to the flimsy water compartment and it completely emptied on to the table it was sitting on assume it is cracked or broken. I then did some more research and the cheap water compartment seems to be a recurring problem so if you are buying this for the steam I would avoid.
customer_reviews.author: jstan

customer_reviews.title: its a good but not great steamer
customer_reviews.text: Just received the steam press today and used it right away. I steamed a dress shirt and when I used the steam, it made water spot on the shirt. In the upper part of the shirt where the arms start was wrinkled. For the most part I like the product despite these errors.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ollivierre

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, function buttons
customer_reviews.text: My Daughter absolutely loves this steam press. It helps her with her sewing projects while joining two pieces of material. The glue requires heat to active it. And this machine does the trick in one press. She says she can do her sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D. Shenberger

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price rubbing free.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it produce heat.but the only problem is wrinkle on the front shoulder part wrinkle r not going. Either way i try they r becoming worst. If we try stretch the cloth even though it is not wirking. Always i will get heat on my hands. I think i should practice more on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Padma A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pressing.
customer_reviews.text: Dont expect a pressing t o be as smooth as an iron and ironing board. Pillowslips will still have wrinkles ad the edge but you can tell they have indeed been pressed. So it has not been an issue. I have an Airbnb and like to have the linens look fresh. This machine does the work.
customer_reviews.author: carol B

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very effective.  But bad workmanship.
customer_reviews.text: After 3 uses, I noticed the side medal plate that comes down is starting to have rust spots. I live in CA and the unit is kept in a dry room.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great steam iron.
customer_reviews.text: I love this steam press for ironing a large number of shirts quickly! Just be VERY careful. The top plate gets extremely hot and it is EASY to burn yourself. Pay close attention to where your arms are and don’t allow anyone to use the machine without giving proper instruction. Also, keep the kids and pets away.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyRN

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: The steam press is just a bit small and a little difficult to use. It doesn’t stay at temperature long enough and might as well use a spray bottle instead of trying the steam part as it’s difficult to actually get a spray out of it. It’s slower than jus grabbing my iron.
customer_reviews.author: djwilli

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Steamfast machine. It provides a lot of steam, and the correct amount of heat for the materials we're pressing. The board is a bit smaller than I expected, but it is fine for pressing clothing. All in all, a great machine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Van Effen

customer_reviews.title: Best steamer I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several different types of steamers and have been disappointed, and was about at the point that they were all practically useless. Then I read the reviews and decided to try this one. This one works very well. I'd buy it again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: works great. i haven't used a traditional iron in over ...
customer_reviews.text: works great. i haven't used a traditional iron in over 20 years. My last steam press died and I ordered this one. no to big or to small. its perfect. can get my clothes ironed in a fraction of the time it takes with traditional ironing
customer_reviews.author: lorianne66

customer_reviews.title: Great product love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this steam press , easy to use , fast heat up and great steam , great size takes me no time to do my jeans only have to do one side of pants other looks great, my shirts very easy to do and no time at all , used to hate ironing now so easy thank you great product
customer_reviews.author: Tx customer

customer_reviews.title: but this press is amazing! I found a video on YouTube that demonstrated ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually leave feedback because things are usually just what they are, but this press is amazing! I found a video on YouTube that demonstrated the right way to use this and let me just say that I love owning this press. It used to take me 15 minutes to press my 3xl dress shirts, now I can professionally press a shirt in about 6 minutes. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Great for right handed people, not so for lefty’s
customer_reviews.text: I own a small rental business which I press a ton of linens, so I purchased this press and I love it! I’m able to press 120” round tablecloths in 3 minutes each opposed to 10 minutes each. The only problem I had is it’s design is geared to right handed people and not left handed, which I had a little time to get use to it
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Krause

customer_reviews.title: It is like an espresso machine where you have to learn the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had the press for 3 months and so far i lime the product. You do need the stand. It is like an espresso machine where you have to learn the art of using it right..it takes few attempts but once you get the hang of it, your shirts look professionally done. I do use starch and limit the steam to non cotton shirts. You do need a traditional iron for touchups from time to time...eventually i will have mastered the product and the iron will be put away.
customer_reviews.author: Majid Rizvi

customer_reviews.title: Throw away your old iron...
customer_reviews.text: I am particular about clothing, even weekend clothes. My normal ironing time was cut to MORE than half of regular time. The unit is very easy to operate. Steam comes out quickly. Things that are important to me: I will cut down on shirt cleaning bills. Figure with the cost of an above middle grade quality shirt,cleaning enough, and you could buy another shirt for the amount of time you wore it. I am unable to stand for long times, and using this on my ceramic tile table is perfect. I ordered the stand for the press, but it's not necessary. This is a good investment because it will save time and money.
customer_reviews.author: ASF

customer_reviews.title: practice makes perfect
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of practice I found it quick and easy to press clothes as well as linens and napkins. Learning to fold and turn items is the trick: top of shirts, the bottom, then sleeves; tees shirts from top then fold as if packing and press; slacks smooth pants legs and press; pillow cases fold in half. While turning items be very careful of the hot top surface. Much faster than hand iron
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for your money!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Steam Press. My father had a high end dry-cleaning plant so I was accustomed to using his professional pressing machines to do my own clothes. I am really impressed with the job this machine does. It certainly helped that I already knew how to use a professional machine before purchasing one for my home. It has a larger pressing area than any home electric presser that I have ever seen (3 of my family members have 3 different machines to compare to mine) and that is the main reason I purchased this particular machine. The steam pressure is excellent and was a bonus. I highly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Harvey

customer_reviews.title: NOT SO GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunatelly does not work as described..... doesnt get rid of ALL wrinkles and temps choose for the different kind of metrails are not accurate..... now I CANT return it because I waited for too long, but O would love to be consider to do so.
customer_reviews.author: chaparrita

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: It takes about five minutes for the iron to be hot enough to allow the steam function to work, but when it works, it works! Would be nice to have interchangeable pads to prevent buildup.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream come true
customer_reviews.text: I make little girl purses that require me to use iron-on interfacing on the lining. In the past few years I have been using a hand held iron to complete this task. I will iron the iron-on interfacing unto the lining panels for about 3 hours at a time. (making 75 purses at a time). With the Steam press machine, I just accomplished the job in 40 minuets. Love the time saved!!! I didn't use the steam feature because it requires a dry iron.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with my purchase! After reading multiple reviews on many products I picked the winner. Ease of use is only the beginning, it dies a better job than the professionals on my dress shirts. So money saved! Khakis and my dress pants looked better than the dry cleaner! My summer linen wardrobe looks fabulous without any starch in a quarter of the time. No longer will I need to send holiday linens to the dry cleaners. Worth every penny, only used steam sometimes. No problems with wrinkles. Thanks fir a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great asset for anyone steaming products large or small.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this steamer for a year now. I have had no issues with the product. I own a linen business and this steamer has been a great asset. The steamer warms quickly. It is easy to refill the water reservoir. I am able to steam through a 120" round table cloth folded. It does take a few second to a minute between steams to build back up. This is to be expected when steaming for long periods of time. Lid locks down for easy and safe carrying of the steamer. It also has a beeper to notify you when press time has been reached.
customer_reviews.author: ADF1028

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver for home
customer_reviews.text: Steam Fast Press is light weight, easy to use on a table top. Needed more room for material and the table top was safer. Not the size for fabric to easily feed through from back to front or reverse. This is more meant to feed from side to side. Great to press clothing. I used this for wedding napkins, table runners, sashes, etc.. It was a time saver. Was not able to do large table linens. Works great for sewing projects.
customer_reviews.author: Trese Kampmueller

customer_reviews.title: Really great product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has turned a task I hate into one I almost like. Almost. It is easy to operate and have been completely reliable so far. It takes some practice o figure out the best way to position the clothes in order to get the most production, but once you find the way that works for you, it works over and over again. Its fast, too... what used to be a task taking me about four hours is now down to one, and the results are better than I ever had with a typical hand held iron.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Vranian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I pressed 15 pairs of pants in 40 minutes. Can’t wait to use on my sewing projects.
customer_reviews.author: LSW

customer_reviews.title: Why Did I Wait So Long to Get One?
customer_reviews.text: I use this to interface fabric for sewing. Love the large pressing area. Works great
customer_reviews.author: The Smith's

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely Love it. I have a bad back and neck. I use a kitchen chair to sit in while doing the laundry. Makes life so much easier. I press everything. Expect for my underwear. Maybe do that later. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Terry W. Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Time cur in half
customer_reviews.text: This takes a few minutes to heat up, but once it does, it works great. truly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia, NJ

customer_reviews.title: no steam
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to get it to steam. I have the correct amount of water. It heats well but no steam
customer_reviews.author: Arietta Marie Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: I work for the Department of Justice and I have to wear a uniform to work. This iron has really made me stand out. With the right combination of starch and this iron you will make a lasting and outstanding impression on others. I get compliments on my uniform all the time. It is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Large enough to do the job but not too big to handle
customer_reviews.text: Not so big that it's cumbersome but big enough to press all of my long sleeve shirt in about 4 moves and took less than 2 minutes. I hate ironing but I love crisp looking shirts and slacks. This really did the job well, easily, and quickly. Wish I had purchased this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Mazzan

customer_reviews.title: Love it... On/Off switch need serious redesign to earn 5*
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and put it on testing. without much experience, I was able to produce wrinkle free shirts within minutes. It does take couple of minutes to heat up and for the steamer to start working, but works well after that. Only reason I am giving 4* is because the 'on/off' switch is in the back and you need to be concious to not touch any of the surface while switching off. This is not complicated.. I dont understand why they would keep on/off switch in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Balaji Krishnamurthy

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this. Becuase I sew a lot and need to constantly press my fabric but also adhere interfacing, this saved me a ton of time. I can press many smaller pieces effectively cutting my prep time in half, which helps me speed up my production time. The steam feature seems to be a little weak for me but I don't normally need it, I just use my own squirt bottle to control the amount of water that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: The thing we like the most is how each time my husband uses ...
customer_reviews.text: The thing we like the most is how each time my husband uses it, he feels like what took me so long to buy this for him. Before this purchase he did not like to iron. The thing we like least is how small the water portion is.
customer_reviews.author: India Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like a hassle to me.
customer_reviews.text: Personally wasn't a fan. I think ironing is easier. Trying to line up the shirts and get the whole thing pressed was a pain. Maybe it just takes practice but I just sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Polly026

customer_reviews.title: Better than a regular iron
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the steamfast iron to help me with my event planning business. Ironing table linens takes a long time. I hoped this would help save me some time. It’s much faster than using a regular iron. It’s also easy to get additional creases in the table linens when I’m using it. Overall it was definitely worth the investment and it does save me time.
customer_reviews.author: piratequeen

customer_reviews.title: Best Feature Set compared to Singer Brand
customer_reviews.text: Eminently satisfied. I previously had a similar press made by Singer, but this one has several advantages: 1) Larger board 2) The top half open wider. More room to arrange garment w/o getting burned. 3) When lifting the handle, a spring automatically opens the top to full open position 4) The steam is very powerful 5) A chime signifies when it's ready to open, which isn't very long 6) lastly the reservoir slides open for easy filling.
customer_reviews.author: Biofilm believer

customer_reviews.title: Timesaver!!!!!!!! clean creases!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Home Steamer press .I have saved alot of money by getting this. The creases are clean. I save a huge amount of time by using this instead of a traditional iron.
customer_reviews.author: darryl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Steamer
customer_reviews.text: I really love this new steamer. It is light weight enough for me to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Marie N.

customer_reviews.title: Stains on clothing
customer_reviews.text: I had brown stains on t-shirts and almost anything put through. It would be fine on dark trousers/jeans but anything light colored ended up with brown spots where the steam comes through.
customer_reviews.author: Simon C.

customer_reviews.title: was well package and it works GREAT! It has a slightly larger pressing surface than ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived timely, was well package and it works GREAT! It has a slightly larger pressing surface than its competitors which makes pressing faster. I love the steam feature on it....I didn't think I would like the way it was set up, but it really works well and I am quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: sbarbara

customer_reviews.title: Steam not iron!
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to handle my beddings, curtains, and clothes with this steamer. I wish I had it much sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Myrna from CA

customer_reviews.title: Quickly irons
customer_reviews.text: I love how quickly I can iron my husband's shirts after I got use to it. He wears 100% cotton so i do alot of ironing. I also.love how it times itself and signals me when to raise the arm to keep from burning clothes. I know some people complained about burning their knuckles so I bought some glove with extra protection for my knuckles.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: You're much better off with an old fashioned iron. This big bulky thing is so difficult to use. Slightest mistake and you'll have a permanent crease in your shirts. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Kareem

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I get the job done in half the time and a much better job than a regular iron. It will pay for itself in 2 months compared to the cost of the dry cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Cut my ironing time in half!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the ease of use. Having neck/shoulder pain this has helped in that area as well as cut my ironing in half!
customer_reviews.author: DKP

customer_reviews.title: Makes fusing easy!
customer_reviews.text: I make bags that require a thick fusible & it took FOREVER to do it with my regular iron. This steam press makes it so much faster & easier with no "iron" dents that I would sometimes get. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Peg Lown

customer_reviews.title: smaller than I expected - difficult to get shirts ironed ...
customer_reviews.text: smaller than I expected - difficult to get shirts ironed 360 degress without leaving wrionkles on one side or the other...
customer_reviews.author: E. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I can tell you that this product is amazing and probably among the best investments I have made
customer_reviews.text: I got the product out of the box and started pressing shirts. I can tell you that this product is amazing and probably among the best investments I have made. I cannot conceive of how much money this product will save me from dry cleaning bills and the results for dress shirts are outstanding. Throw away your old iron and ironing board. The footprint is small. The unit is sturdy and well made. I bought mine through the outlet and it was a bargain. The size of the board is great for men's shirts and was worth the extra $50 that I paid to upgrade from the smaller unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory P. Clare

customer_reviews.title: I’m so happy
customer_reviews.text: I received it quick. And it was so easy to to put together out of the box. What’s great makes the job of pressing clothes so much easier and quicker. Thanks I love it
customer_reviews.author: carlos Blackshire

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: cut my work in half and good for my carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.author: valerie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work well
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work well . I returned the first day .
customer_reviews.author: Miro

customer_reviews.title: Steam Fast SF-680 Digital Fabric Steam Press
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying my Steam Fast, good quality me and my wife like for our cloths to be crisp when go to work or out, my cloths look like they were pressed at the cleaners. I also purchased the strand which makes using the press more convenient, it would be nice if the stand had an adjustable height, but overall enjoying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the product was reviewed by others
customer_reviews.author: Judd Toshtig

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: This saves so much time. Should have got one of these sooner. Didn’t like ironing too much but this is much faster and you aren’t standing for long periods of time. The pad they came with it should be a little bigger so it covers the whole shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lucido

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative! (but just so..)
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a few times and I still have use for my old Black and Decker iron! Pros: ironing area is big and so does help out in ironing small clothes (will help for those with children!). Cons: 1. potential for burning your hands while placing the clothes or moving them in between pressing 2. Manual talks about using distilled water for steam - not tap water! 3. Only works well for certain type of clothes Yes, still keep the old iron (don't throw it away). This one is good only if there is not much of wrinkles; otherwise you are better off using the old, the normal iron.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Clothes come out looking like they were dry cleaned and pressed. Much faster than using an iron and presses clothes with 100 lbs of pressure and steam if desired.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Bergman

customer_reviews.title: fabric steam press machine
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for what I purchased it for. Havent tried the steam part yet. We made a couple dozen shirts with iron on decals and letters worked wonderful for that. My husband pressed pants and did a great job. Shirts are rather tricky I must say going to take a bit of practice to press them without adding unwanted lines due to not getting fabric flat. All and all great machine
customer_reviews.author: Elaine R Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool product.  We us it every week 4 kids and lots of laundry.  Biggest surface you can get the better.
customer_reviews.text: There is a technique to using it. For example knit shirts get bunched up in in hudge away from you then pull out bit by bit to press. The steam is for just one second. Also if really want positive results add starch to the rinse cycle of your wash(in the softner despenser)Setup a good spot to work. Good instructions included, but your developed technique and common sense will be what make the product most useful.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for fusing interfacing to fabric!
customer_reviews.text: This product was awesome. I used it to apply interfacing to my fabric for a sewing project. It cut an hour plus job down to about 10 minutes. Love it! Product was described as not new but very good condition. It looked brand new when I received it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for dinner napkins
customer_reviews.text: Aside from pressing dinner linens there is little use for this. It does not open wide enough for table clothes or bedding. Spend more for a rotary or less for a great hand iron.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse Z.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Snap to set up and start using immediately. Press, just on damp shirt, without added steam, was quick and crisp. Lasts through multiple wears. Wish it were larger, as I am over 6' tall, and repositioning garments adds steps to a breezy process, but that it a minor complaint. Will need to get a few months more use out of it in order to test its reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way better than an Iron
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and saves dry cleaning money. WAY BETTER than any Iron!!!
customer_reviews.author: MARY ROBERGE

customer_reviews.title: Really neat.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is easy to use and heats up fast.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Heintz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, faster ironing with comfortable sitting
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use in sitting position than standing with regular irons
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I expected dry cleaning type quality work but got less than iron quality pressing. I should have purchased a steamer instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for home use
customer_reviews.text: Work well except wi leave little round indentation on some fabrics. This can be eliminated if the head has cover to distribute the steam better. It takes a little while to fully heat up and steam up, but once it’s there it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Khanh

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid product
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly built product. Without starch, gave my shirts a great press. Amazed at how easy pressing is. Only thing I would have liked better is a little more surface space. But overall, it looks like my trips to the cleaners will be minimized.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Estwick

customer_reviews.title: Really like this. Keep it on when pulling stuff out ...
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. Keep it on when pulling stuff out of the dryer. Quickly presses shirts and pants. Water reservoir is small and the steam cycle is very slow; but other than that is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kelley

customer_reviews.title: savin' time and money!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! once I figured out how to exactly place garments on board and an effective sequence for ironing, then exactly what the included pad was for i can now iron as if I were getting paid by the piece. This is a wonderful tool for the home for someone who has a lot of ironing to do but doesn't have a lot of time. Simple as heat press and go. I have saved enough money pressing my own clothes over past couple of months to almost pay for the press. Professional look without the inconvenience of business hours or Closed Sundays..Get my laundry done on my time. Convenience, savings, professional press....can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chanady

customer_reviews.title: Returned ASAP!!
customer_reviews.text: It leaves water spots when using steam. Not made for jeans and kinda small.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Worth it just in time savings
customer_reviews.text: Love it, saves me TONS of time. Works well for anything that had a pleat
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Stanton

customer_reviews.title: WARNING to fellow OCD sufferers...  this is addicting!
customer_reviews.text: We got this to press apparel samples that we sell from, I now find myself pressing the trim on my bedsheets, how sick is that?!? WARNING... if you've got the space to set this up, you will find yourself pressing every wrinkle in sight, it is that addicting... or maybe it just brings out my OCD?
customer_reviews.author: D. Hallet

customer_reviews.title: Product As Described
customer_reviews.text: I use this to press iron-on interfacing on fabric. It works great - i have a very nice finished product. There are a few drawbacks about the product... It takes a long time to heat up and re-heat between cycles. Some times over two minutes to reheat. So you press one part of your fabric and have to wait two minutes to be able to press again. The "throat" or neck is shallow. In other words if you are pressing something large it gets bunched up between the presser and the arm base.
customer_reviews.author: Momajor

customer_reviews.title: Avoid it
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. It’s past 30 days and item is a junk but can’t return. Should have bought from Target where they accomodate any return for 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: amir hendiani

customer_reviews.title: This works great
customer_reviews.text: I like this steam press so far, It works great use it about once a week, use for sewing and clothes, Have not had any problems so far
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Manna

customer_reviews.title: Great iron press
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the SF-680 Steam Press and have not use my regular hand held iron. Took some time to get use to hot pressing cloths but now I can press shirts and pants in less than 5 min. Creased in shirts and pants last longer than regular iron.
customer_reviews.author: B. Quan

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have been using this presser to iron curtains, Chaircovers, and clothes.
customer_reviews.author: diamond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I wished it was a bit longer but at the price, the size is fitting.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, gets really hot and the steam is great.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Works Just As I Expected
customer_reviews.text: It works just as expected. I can iron about 20 long sleeve shirts in about an hour. It works best if you can find a place where you can sit down and have the press a little below eye level so that you can see everything more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mtwillo

customer_reviews.title: Hand held steamer way to go
customer_reviews.text: Steam function not working. Weird sound happens when using the steam function. No steam comes through. Product only used about 4 times since purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not enough room to manoeuvre garment under or around the board. Needs redesigning. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great press iron.
customer_reviews.text: Best iron out there for pressing shirts for iron ons! Heats up in less than 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: KimmerS

customer_reviews.title: Great transaction. Thank you
customer_reviews.text: This is my second press in five years and I use it every week.When this one stops working, I'll buy another one from Amazon as I did before. Great transaction. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

product_meta.title: Steamfast SF-680 Digital Steam Press with Multiple Fabric Settings and Steam Burst Function,Stainless/Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Steam PressThe Steamfast SF-680 Deluxe Digital Steam Press is the ultimate solution for professional quality pressing in the comfort of your own home. Delivering dry-cleaners results without the hassle, cost or chemicals, the Deluxe Digital Steam Press smoothes wrinkles and creates crisp creases in seconds. Elegant digital controls offer a variety of temperature settings – simply select your type of material and the heated non-stick pressing plate will press your fabric safely and efficiently. With a pressing surface that measures 25 x 10.5 inches, the Deluxe Digital Steam Press is an intuitive, cost-effective way to get the professional look you want. Do not use electrical cord as a handle

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
IMPORTANT INTERNATIONAL DISCLAIMER: This item is built to meet U.S. voltage requirements and may not function properly when used in conjunction with external devices that alter or convert voltage or frequency of electricity. Improper use or shipping the product outside the U.S. will void all warranties.
feature_bullets: SUPERIOR SATISFACTION — When you choose a Steamfast product, you’re investing in superior performance and design that will deliver total satisfaction. If not we’ll replace it for 2 years. Supported by a customer service team based in Andover, KS.
QUICK HEAT UP TIME — A 10-ounce easy-fill water tank heats up in 3 minutes, steam press automatically shuts off and alerts if left idle for prolonged periods
MULTIPLE FABRIC SETTINGS — Digital controls with 5 fabric settings (nylon, silk, wool, cotton, linen), two steam burst buttons located on the handle produce a powerful burst of steam
LARGE STEAMING SURFACE — Non-stick pressing surface measures 25 x 10. 5 inches, tabletop size with press lock feature allows for easier carrying and storage
EQUIPPED FOR THE JOB — Accessories include a spray bottle, pressing cushion, and measuring cup to aid in the pressing process
SANITIZE WITH STEAM — Steam kills 99.9% of germs and bacteria.
Built to meet U. S. voltage requirements. Certified, safety-tested, and warrantied for use only in the U. S.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
